block.p: Jennifer M. Ametrano and Juan Carlos Rodriguez were married last evening at St. Ann Catholic Church in West Palm Beach, Fla. The Rev. Seamus Murtagh performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Rodriguez, 34, works in New York as the managing director for advertising sales of The Wall Street Journal Americas, a foreign language newspaper insert appearing in Central and South America. She is a board member of the International Advertising Association, also in New York. She graduated from Wake Forest.
Jennifer M. Ametrano and Juan Carlos Rodriguez were married last evening at St. Ann Catholic Church in West Palm Beach, Fla. The Rev. Seamus Murtagh performed the ceremony.
Jennifer M. Ametrano and Juan Carlos Rodriguez were married last evening at St. Ann Catholic Church in West Palm Beach, Fla. The Rev. Seamus Murtagh performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Rodriguez, 34, works in New York as the managing director for advertising sales of The Wall Street Journal Americas, a foreign language newspaper insert appearing in Central and South America. She is a board member of the International Advertising Association, also in New York. She graduated from Wake Forest.
She is the daughter of Janice M. Ametrano and Joseph M. Ametrano of Guilford, Conn. Her father owns Ashley's Ice Cream, an ice cream parlor in New Haven.
Mr. Rodriguez, 39, is the owner of Palm Beach Home Health Inc., a home health care agency, and of RTL Rehab Clinic, an outpatient rehabilitation facility, both in West Palm Beach.

He is the son of True S. Rodriguez of Lake Worth, Fla., and the late Juan Marcial Rodriguez. His mother is the administrator of RTL Rehab Clinic. His father lived in Houston and was a professional polo player.
